text: Well, I think there's a mindset from the
Chernobyl um accident that, you know,
nuclear power is is is verbolton. Uh
quite frankly, 80% of the power in
France comes from the nuclear industry.
Surely we can be as bold as the French.
There's a waste disposal problem. The
French have a reprocessing system.
Secretary Chu, who I admire greatly in
this administration, believes that in
the next 10 or 15 years, new technology
will develop better than reprocessing.
So, what I'm willing to do, work with
the administration to provide a uh jump
start of building nuclear power plants,
loan guarantees that will back these
plants up, reform the regulatory process
like they do in France, so that we can
uh you really get on with developing
nuclear power. I understand
environmental concerns, but every
technology has some downside. I think
nuclear power has proven over time to be
a safe, reliable form of power. And the
good news, it doesn't emit CO2. The
other good news is it creates a lot of
high-tech jobs that we need and a lot of
environmentalists are changing their
position. The environmental community I
tried to work on a comprehensive energy
bill with Senator Lieberman and Carrie
was pretty practical quite frankly.
